2025-08-18T15:16:34.179000Z user

Scene Notes Prologue Point of view Character: Halana Vordeaux Halana awakens late for her graduation ceremony due to seemingly being trapped within a dream. Within this dream she was apparently conversing with the Sun. As she dressess she ponders the messages received and though she tries to write it off as just a dream concocted from pre-graduation jitters she cannot help but wonder. A friend enters the room aghast that she is not ready and hurries her along. During the ceremony one of the Elders eyes her suspisciously when her name is called, whispering to a colleague. After the ceremony there is a dance. Halana gets very drunk and is led away by a handsome stranger. When she awakes she finds that she is in the hands of Dark Workers who are questioning her about her dreams. She is forced to come to terms with the reality of them. One of the Elders is there too and she is forced to watch them torture and kill him. The scene ends with the Dark Workers demanding that she be more forthcoming with the content of her dreams.

Chapter 1 - Harvest Festival Point of view Character: Kalina Dodson The Palace is abuzz with preparations for the yearly Harvest Festival. The cool Autumn air blows as the Sun begins to near the horizon, chilling the Princess ever so slightly. She smiles pushing a loose lock of hair behind her ears. Lady Vivianna continues to taunt her cousin Kalina, attempting to distract her from her training with Gael, the Greatest Swordsmaster in all of Talanvost. Kalina ignores this and doubles down in her attempts to land a blow, which only yeilds her more punishment and admonishments from Gael to stop letting her guard down. Vivianna continues with her jeers and the longer she continues the more Kalina loses focus, though it has more to do with Kalina's strange dreams as of late than her cousin's annoyance. Kalina continues to take a beating from Gael's practice sword until Vivianna begins urging her to stop making a fool of herself and insists she get ready for the Festival. The Lunar Goddess will be most offended should a member of the Royal Family refuse to attend the annual ritual. Kalina, frustrated with her inability to best Gael, and fed up with her older cousin ends her lesson early and begrudgingly heads back to her chambers. Chapter 2 - Royal Duty Point of view Character: Kalina Dodson Kalina is thoroughly unimpressed by the Royal life. She has always despised her status, but thus was her lot in life. Vivianna and her are as close as sisters, however Kali will never have a claim to the throne. If she did, she would probably reject it. Her cousin enters her chambers to chat while Kali's servants help her finish dressing. She tells her of a suitor that is likely to be present tonight, however Kalina barely hears - her dreams of late have been vivid and troubling. Her thoughts have been elsewhere for the past few weeks, interfering even with her sword training and most keeping her back from remaining fully present for the Festival. The conversation continues between her and Vivianna, with her cousin doing most of the talking, painting the picture of their Royal lifestyle. Vivianna goes on to stress the need for Kalina to find a suitor and heavily suggests that she put her sword down and start acting more lady-like. After all, Vivianna will one day be Queen and she is fully intent on naming Kalina Duchess and having her at her Right Hand. She mentions this in an offhanded way but when Kali doesn't respond she continues on about the suitor she has found. Her tone is giddy and she is positively thrilled at the idea, yet she insists on keeping his identity secret until the Festival, stating that she wants to surpirse her cousin. Kalina rolls her eyes at this as her servants begin to work on her hair. Vivianna excuses herself to go "nap" prior to the festivities but before she leaves Vivianna reminds her that this will be Kalina's last Autumn Festival before her 18th Name Day, and says "So there's no wiggling out of it this time. You have to participate." Kalina winces at this, remembering the Royal decorum which she must, by law, uphold. Chapter 3 - The Lord Of Korlan Point of view Character: Kalina Dodson Once the ball starts Kalina hangs around the edges of the party, sneaking mead in secret, attempting to remain numb, hoping to avoid her cousin. She manages to find a safe space near Gael in the shadows. Everyone is too afraid of him to ever socialize very much, plus he doesn't judge her drinking too harshly. The two of them strike up a discussion of swordplay and due to the slight inebriation Kalina accidentally broaches a topic best left alone when she begins to question him about his homeland. He responds with vagaries and jokes about the mythology that surrounds him, laughing back and forth with Kalina until she abandons the topic entirely. A short while later a flustered Vivianna finally finds her long lost cousin and berates her for such antics. After dragging her from her hiding spot Vivianna sets her up to dance with the young Lord Haversham of Tramalax, a man of 23 who came into his Lordship after his family was murdered by Dark Workers. Kalina takes kindly to Haversham after the introductions are made and gladly joins him on the dance floor. (Kalina and Seth meet prior to the dance and hit it off) Due to Royal Customs the floor is cleared for the two of them after an announcement from the King about Kali's upcoming 18th Name Day. Haversham casually expresses his willingness to assist Kalina in going through with the Royal Drudgery required of her on this night and his compassionate approach catches Kalina off guard. She expected him to be just another snobbish Noble, but his down to earth demeanor and similar background are quite appealing to the slightly drunk Kalina. They chat for a good half-hour over drinks (mild wine this time instead of mead) before taking the floor and after their ceremonial dance ends Kalina even goes so far as to kiss him quickly. She blushes and apologizes, as she did not intend to be so forward, however the alcohol has lowered her inhibitions. He just smiles and kisses her back in response and they exit the dance floor and the Festivities resume.

*Kalina and Haversham do not enter into any type of Romantic Relationship, but do bond as the best of friends and also Battle Partners later on in the whole of the tale as his Command of Korlan becomes essential. Kalina meets and falls in love with Diana as "First Light" unfolds, so though their first meeting seems promising, Kali and Seth never would have worked. Chapter 4 - The Watcher Point of view Character: Kalina Dodson Afterwards she goes to relieve herself but upon returning from the restroom she is approached by an old woman who identifies herself as "Friede" who pulls her to the side and begins insisting that she "Wake Up" starts her all kinds of strange Pseudo-Relgious jargon - things about Star Walkers, Demons in the Box, and "Orunibu". Kalina is thoroughly baffled by the woman's strange ramblings because of how eerily familiar some of the things she is saying are. It is as though this "Friede" has been watching her dreams of late. Everything the woman is saying is disjointed and seems thoroughly insane, though Kalina can't deny the synchronous nature of certain key phrases the woman keeps fluidly stating. She grows terribly uncomfortable upon this realization and starts to look around frantically for Haversham or Vivianna, but then Friede becomes more direct, telling Kalina to stop pretending that her words are not hitting home. She grabs Kalina's arm suddenly and stops her from seeking to escape. When Kalina looks back at her and finally stares into her eyes she is mezmerized. Friede holds her gaze for what seems like forever to Kali, then tells her, "You're not going to like what's about to happen, but I'm afraid things are already in motion. I assume you have your sword?" Kalina just nods, eyes wide, stunned by the odd encounter. Friede's last words didn't even register fully, but the old woman continues, "Good. You're going to need it." Intermission - Of Those Who Speak Point of view Character: Zahara Marshall The Seat of the Sun Speakers is abuzz with news of Halana's sudden disappearance and as rumours abound, her dear friend has an uneasy feeling. Chapter 5 - Darkness Invades Just then, as Friede lets go of her arm and takes a step back, the Party suddenly descends into madness. A group of Dark Workers who were covertly already attending the party simultaneously detonate several canisters of poison gas and begin slaughtering anyone they run across. Those whom the gas doesn't incapacitate are cut down as they try to escape, while those attempting to crawl away begin coughing up blood before they make it very far. After the initial uproar Paravese Guards pour into the Festival Square, but this only generates more chaos and bloodshed as some Dark Workers take on the Guards while others blend back in with the crowds of people, attacking civilians at random and releasing more canisters of poison.

Chapter 6 - First Blood Friede has disappeared leaving Kalina alone as a group of 4 Dark Workers, clad in Assassin's Garb approach. In the midst of the chaos Kalina stood there stunned as she watched things unfold in slow motion. When the team of Assassins arrive she is virtually alone. She snaps out of her stupor mere seconds before the first Assassin's blade reaches her. She deftly unsheath's her sword and slaps the Assassin's weapon away. A brief swordfight ensues leaving Kalina badly injured and barely alive. The 4 Assassin's lay dead amidst the chaotic scene - Kalina managing to finish off the last one before her wounds caused her to pass out. Luckily her newfound friend is there to drag her limp body away from the Palace.

Chapter 7 Those Awaiting The Return Friede deposits her on the saddle of her companion Torvan Dochavich who after exchanging a few key words with Friede gallops off towards Lauriden in the night, with a half-dead Kalina in tow. It is a long ride through the mountainous forests between Paravesian Manor and the Mythical City of Lauriden. They stop along the way at a cabin where Torvan manages to bribe an old friend into field dressing Kalina's wounds. It is then that they discover the poison has already started to work. Briefly it is vaguely discussed between Torvan and the old friend, that the Dark Worker's "Knew about her" that they had "Been waiting", and they chose tonight hoping to send a message to the Tree Whisperers. Torvan coerces his friend to apply a poltice to Kalina's wounds, paying the man with his entire bag of Silver, knowing that the poltice will only suffice to slow down the effects of the Dark Worker's poison. He then resaddles and takes off into the night headed North. Only the Healers in Lauriden can save her now, and save her they must. They arrive without further incident, though Kalina has been unconscious since she killed the last Assassin. Intermission - Yet Have Not Ears Point of view Character: Zahara Marshall Halana's friend takes her concerns and meager evidence before the Seat only to find their refusal to even look into the matter unsettling. Chapter 8 - Lauriden When Kalina awakes she is surprised to find herself in the care of The Elves. In all of her 17 years she has never left the Palace, though she has always dreamed of traveling, especially to Lauriden. The city is a thing of Myth. In the center of the Vorheel Mountain Range, long before any remaining historical records were even thought of, a large section of the mountains were removed by some Ancient Advanced Technology (Of which still baffles the people of the current day) clearing the land and leveling it. There The Garden of Sacred Ash Trees was planted and around that a city evolved. With farmlands a plenty, protected on all sides by the rest of the Vorheel Mountains the Mythical City of Lauriden flourished, the only remaining home of the Elves which tend to the Sacred Gardens religiously. The Elves are also the only peoples in all the land to not shun Tree Whisperers. Others do so openly, superstitiously terrified of those Chosen by the Trees. The Elves, while regarded as a Holy Race, are also ostracized by the people of Talanvost, mostly due to their open association and alliance with the Tree Whisperers. The True History goes back further than any currently in the world have record of, yet The Elves have records that even the Tree Whisperer's regularly seek in their Libraries. Lauriden is the oldest City in all of Talanvost and the only home of the Elves. Only the Seat of the Sun Speakers rivals its renown, though the two are polar opposites. In all the land there is no where as lush and fertile as the Mythical City of the Elves. It is said that Lauriden was where the First Star Walkers descended long ago to seal away the Demons in the Box. The Garden of Sacred Ash was planted as a Symbol of their Triumph, and there it has stood since that day. The Elves view their prime purpose in the world to be that of Care Taking the Garden of Sacred Ash. They say that Men are charged with Care Taking the rest of Talanvost, yet only the Tree Whisperer's seem to remember that Divine Decree.

Chapter 9 - Bedrest Slowly but surely Kalina is nursed back to health. The poison in her system takes weeks to neutralize. She is fed a tart concoction every 6 hours and allowed no food or water until her fever finally breaks, a sign that the worst part is over. Her sword arm is badly injured, and a gash in her ribs had to be sown up immediately upon her arrival. Torvan's friend did a decent job seeing to it that she even arrived, but it was nearly too late according to the Eleven Physicians. Kalina is ordered to stay in bed after the poison is dealt with, to allow for her ribcage and arm to heal, but she is given ample food and drink to satiate her. She notices a slight numbness in the tips of her toes and after asking about it she is told that it is an after effect of the antidote she was given. She is warned to remain in bed and only to arise to relieve herself, lest the numbness spread.

Chapter 10 -Wherever The Path May Lead The maid that brings her food each day becomes friendly over the weeks and many conversations ensue. Elvish and of the same age as Kalina, Diana begins to spend more and more of her free time entertaining Kalina. Torvan has been stopping by each day at noon to check in, but hasn't said much other than to promise that answers to her questions were coming but that first she must heal. One day as Kalina and Diana are playing a board game he enters the room and takes a seat. After studying the two of them in silence for a moment he tells Diana to stay, "You'll need this information just as much as she." When Diana asks what he means by that he says simply, "You've entered her Field now. There's no escape. You're as linked to her as her cousin back in Paravese. Wherever her Path leads, you will follow. Torvan proceeds to relay to Kalina all of what transpired, that Dark Workers attacked and that the Assassins were after her specifically because of her Soul Encodings and warns that it will not be her last encounter with them. He explains in a vague manner that he and Friede are known as The Watchers - Those Who Await The Return. It is within this conversation that Kalina begins to understand some of her previous dreams.

Chapter 11 - The Forgotten Knowledge A week later the Physicians discharge her from the MedBay and she moves into Diana's quaint home for the time being. Shortly after settling Torvan stops by to invite them both to a private dinner with his "Colleagues" who are very eager to meet Kalina. These Colleagues turn out to be a group of 14 Tree Whisperers led by Korvana. The conversation that ensues leaves Kali quite confused, yet also intrigued. All of the Tree Whisperers refer to her repeatedly as "The Warlord of Light" and when Kalina begins to assure them that she is not who they think she is Korvana informs her that the prophecies foretelling her Return are recorded here in Lauriden and asks if she should obtain them as proof. Kalina starts to decline but Torvan chimes in filling in parts of Kalina's story that synchronistically ring true. The resonance of the man's words sober Kalina enough for her to listen to the rest of what Korvana and the Tree Whisperers have to say. They warn her of The Demons in the Box and use the current world state to explain the very real existence of "Orunibu" a psychic parasite that exists outside of time and space which keeps humanity as a whole blind to The Forgotten Knowledge. The dinner concludes with Kalina agreeing to allow for Korvana to tutor her in The Forgotten Knowledge in order that she might combat the tactics of Orunibu and The Demons in the Box.

INTERLUDE - The Failures Of Druids Point of view Character: Halana Vordeaux In her captivity Halana is faced with a harsh reality. The Speaker is informed that the Druids have failed entirely, and her abduction is explained by the Spirits of the Sun to be an elaborate plan designed to keep her from ever fulfilling her Role to assist the Star Walkers Chapter 4 - The Watcher Afterwards she goes to relieve herself but upon returning from the restroom she is approached by an old woman who identifies herself as "Friede" who pulls her to the side and begins insisting that she "Wake Up" starts her all kinds of strange Pseudo-Relgious jargon - things about Star Walkers, Demons in the Box, and "Orunibu". Kalina is thoroughly baffled by the woman's strange ramblings because of how eerily familiar some of the things she is saying are. It is as though this "Friede" has been watching her dreams of late. Everything the woman is saying is disjointed and seems thoroughly insane, though Kalina can't deny the synchronous nature of certain key phrases the woman keeps fluidly stating. She grows terribly uncomfortable upon this realization and starts to look around frantically for Haversham or Vivianna, but then Friede becomes more direct, telling Kalina to stop pretending that her words are not hitting home. She grabs Kalina's arm suddenly and stops her from seeking to escape. When Kalina looks back at her and finally stares into her eyes she is mezmerized. Friede holds her gaze for what seems like forever to Kali, then tells her, "You're not going to like what's about to happen, but I'm afraid things are already in motion. I assume you have your sword?" Kalina just nods, eyes wide, stunned by the odd encounter. Friede's last words didn't even register fully, but the old woman continues, "Good. You're going to need it."

Extended Synopsis The Palace is abuzz with preparations for the yearly Harvest Festival. The cool Autumn air blows as the Sun begins to near the horizon, chilling the Princess ever so slightly. She smiles pushing a loose lock of hair behind her ears. Lady Vivianna continues to taunt her cousin Kalina, attempting to distract her from her training with Gael, the Greatest Swordsmaster in all of Talanvost. Kalina ignores this and doubles down in her attempts to land a blow, which only yeilds her more punishment and admonishments from Gael to stop letting her guard down. Vivianna continues with her jeers and the longer she continues the more Kalina loses focus, though it has more to do with Kalina's strange dreams as of late than her cousin's annoyance. Kalina continues to take a beating from Gael's practice sword until Vivianna begins urging her to stop making a fool of herself and insists she get ready for the Festival. The Lunar Goddess will be most offended should a member of the Royal Family refuse to attend the annual ritual. Kalina, frustrated with her inability to best Gael, and fed up with her older cousin ends her lesson early and begrudgingly heads back to her chambers. Kalina is thoroughly unimpressed by the Royal life. She has always despised her status, but thus was her lot in life. Vivianna and her are as close as sisters, however Kali will never have a claim to the throne. If she did, she would probably reject it. Her cousin enters her chambers to chat while Kali's servants help her finish dressing. She tells her of a suitor that is likely to be present tonight, however Kalina barely hears - her dreams of late have been vivid and troubling. Her thoughts have been elsewhere for the past few weeks, interfering even with her sword training and most keeping her back from remaining fully present for the Festival. The conversation continues between her and Vivianna, with her cousin doing most of the talking, painting the picture of their Royal lifestyle. Vivianna goes on to stress the need for Kalina to find a suitor and heavily suggests that she put her sword down and start acting more lady-like. After all, Vivianna will one day be Queen and she is fully intent on naming Kalina Duchess and having her at her Right Hand. She mentions this in an offhanded way but when Kali doesn't respond she continues on about the suitor she has found. Her tone is giddy and she is positively thrilled at the idea, yet she insists on keeping his identity secret until the Festival, stating that she wants to surpirse her cousin. He then resaddles and takes off into the night headed North. Only the Healers in Lauriden can save her now, and save her they must. They arrive without further incident, though Kalina has been unconscious since she killed the last Assassin. When Kalina awakes she is surprised to find herself in the care of The Elves. In all of her 17 years she has never left the Palace, though she has always dreamed of traveling, especially to Lauriden. The city is a thing of Myth. In the center of the Vorheel Mountain Range, long before any remaining historical records were even thought of, a large section of the mountains were removed by some Ancient Advanced Technology (Of which still baffles the people of the current day) clearing the land and leveling it. There The Garden of Sacred Ash Trees was planted and around that a city evolved. With farmlands a plenty, protected on all sides by the rest of the Vorheel Mountains the Mythical City of Lauriden flourished, the only remaining home of the Elves which tend to the Sacred Gardens religiously. The Elves are also the only peoples in all the land to not shun Tree Whisperers. Others do so openly, superstitiously terrified of those Chosen by the Trees. The Elves, while regarded as a Holy Race, are also ostracized by the people of Talanvost, mostly due to their open association and alliance with the Tree Whisperers. The True History goes back further than any currently in the world have record of, yet The Elves have records that even the Tree Whisperer's regularly seek in their Libraries. Lauriden is the oldest City in all of Talanvost and the only home of the Elves. Only the Seat of the Sun Speakers rivals its renown, though the two are polar opposites. In all the land there is no where as lush and fertile as the Mythical City of the Elves. It is said that Lauriden was where the First Star Walkers descended long ago to seal away the Demons in the Box. The Garden of Sacred Ash was planted as a Symbol of their Triumph, and there it has stood since that day. The Elves view their prime purpose in the world to be that of Care Taking the Garden of Sacred Ash. They say that Men are charged with Care Taking the rest of Talanvost, yet only the Tree Whisperer's seem to remember that Divine Decree. Slowly but surely Kalina is nursed back to health. The poison in her system takes weeks to neutralize. She is fed a tart concoction every 6 hours and allowed no food or water until her fever finally breaks, a sign that the worst part is over. Her sword arm is badly injured, and a gash in her ribs had to be sown up immediately upon her arrival. Torvan's friend did a decent job seeing to it that she even arrived, but it was nearly too late according to the Eleven Physicians. Kalina is ordered to stay in bed after the poison is dealt with, to allow for her ribcage and arm to heal, but she is given ample food and drink to satiate her. She notices a slight numbness in the tips of her toes and after asking about it she is told that it is an after effect of the antidote she was given. She is warned to remain in bed and only to arise to relieve herself, lest the numbness spread. The maid that brings her food each day becomes friendly over the weeks and many conversations ensue. Elvish and of the same age as Kalina, Diana begins to spend more and more of her free time entertaining Kalina. Torvan has been stopping by each day at noon to check in, but hasn't said much other than to promise that answers to her questions were coming but that first she must heal. One day as Kalina and Diana are playing a board game he enters the room and takes a seat. After studying the two of them in silence for a moment he tells Diana to stay, "You'll need this information just as much as she." When Diana asks what he means by that he says simply, "You've entered her Field now. There's no escape. You're as linked to her as her cousin back in Paravese. Wherever her Path leads, you will follow. Torvan proceeds to relay to Kalina all of what transpired, that Dark Workers attacked and that the Assassins were after her specifically because of her Soul Encodings and warns that it will not be her last encounter with them. He explains in a vague manner that he and Friede are known as The Watchers - Those Who Await The Return. It is within this conversation that Kalina begins to understand some of her previous dreams. A week later the Physicians discharge her from the MedBay and she moves into Diana's quaint home for the time being. Shortly after settling Torvan stops by to invite them both to a private dinner with his "Colleagues" who are very eager to meet Kalina. These Colleagues turn out to be a group of 14 Tree Whisperers led by Korvana. The conversation that ensues leaves Kali quite confused, yet also intrigued. All of the Tree Whisperers refer to her repeatedly as "The Warlord of Light" and when Kalina begins to assure them that she is not who they think she is Korvana informs her that the prophecies foretelling her Return are recorded here in Lauriden and asks if she should obtain them as proof. Kalina starts to decline but Torvan chimes in filling in parts of Kalina's story that synchronistically ring true. The resonance of the man's words sober Kalina enough for her to listen to the rest of what Korvana and the Tree Whisperers have to say. They warn her of The Demons in the Box and use the current world state to explain the very real existence of "Orunibu" a psychic parasite that exists outside of time and space which keeps humanity as a whole blind to The Forgotten Knowledge. The dinner concludes with Kalina agreeing to allow for Korvana to tutor her in The Forgotten Knowledge in order that she might combat the tactics of Orunibu and The Demons in the Box. A few weeks into her lessons, which so far consist only of reading volume after volume of Elven Mythology, Torvan announces that Gael has arrived and informs Kalina that he was summonedbspecifically so that she might regain her strength and form with the sword and continue her battle training, stating ominously, as Friede did at the Autumn Festival, that she will soon need it once more. Kalina is overjoyed by this and giddily introduces Gael to Diana. He nonchalantly states, "So I've been replaced?" raising an eyebrow before nodding slightly to Diana and strolling away with a slight smile on his face. Kalina realizes the strangeness of the comment and ponders on just who Gael is in light of all of her studies into the Elven Mythologies.

[Insert Foreshadowing For Gael's Background as it relates]

Her training with Gael begins and is much more intense than ever before. Each day she awakes before dawn and is forced to carry buckets of water back and forth to each of the 13 Tree Whisper's residences. At Sunrise she is given a Bo Staff and told to stand on one leg while watching the 13 eat their breakfast, all the while Gael randomly throws small stones at her which she uses the staff to deflect. Each time she loses her balance or fails to deflect a stone he takes count and after the 13 finish eating she is forced to run a lap around the grove which is roughly a mile. At noon she is given a break to eat a small meal of tasteless barley and water and then then her studies with The Tree Whisperers resume for two hours, after which sword training begins and continues until Sun down. She is given no quarter by Gael who seems to have been holding back. Kalina has trained with him since she was old enough to hold a practice sword, but now it seems as if she has never known what she was doing. He outflanks her at every turn, and each complaint or attempt to placate him verbally only results in adding to his fire. She must learn quickly to defend herself or suffer. Diana becomes very distraught bearing witness to this and takes it upon herself to ensure that each night when Kalina returns home that a hot bath is ready for her along with ample food. This defies Gael's rules but Diana does care, and even plans to confront him on his harsh treatment, but Kalina begs her not to, stating that there is a reason for his overbearing training regimine, though she cannot fathom what. She trusts the man to prepare her for what is to come and tries to educate Diana on what she has learned from The Elvish Mythologies. Diana finds it hard to believe, but when shown some of the notes Kalina has compiled from her homework assigned by the 13 she begrudgingly decides that it is best that she keep her distance from Gael. They discuss one night Kalina's theory that there is more to Gael than he has ever let on, referencing vague passages here and there that speak of what lies beyond the Dagdavorian Hills. Gael has only once mentioned, by accident it seems his origins. Diana seems uninterested and so Kalina abandons the topic of discussion, but cannot help but continue to ponder the thought of how he fits into the bigger picture. It seems more like fate than coincidence, yet she cannot find the confidence nor time to confront him on it due to her greuling schedule.

After only a week when she has managed to get used to the routine, Gael decides that Swords Training will be done with real steel. This intimidates poor Kalina who is always worn down by the end of the day. She has grown to dread Sword Training the most. Had it not been for Diana's nightly meals and support she wouldn't have made it this far, subsisting only on the tasteless lunch and limited sleep. Gael tosses Kalina her old Sword which he recovered and brought with him and unsheaths his monstrous GreatSword. She has never known him to even unsheath it, and can't fathom why he would do so now. He takes his stance and sternly tells her, "You are not to partake in Diana's meals henceforth. Only the barley and water. I won't tell you again." and then launches his attack. Kalina's instincts kick into overdrive as she deftly manages to use every ounce of her previous training to deflect and dodge his unrelenting blows. He seems like a madman actually trying to kill her. After what seems a lifetime she stumbles and falls to the ground. He drives the point of his sword towards her open neck at full force, yet manages to stop as just the tip pierces her skin drawing a small trickle of blood. As she gasps for air, heart beating frantically he repeats himself. She nods fearfully and he sheaths his sword. "If I were an enemy you would be dead by now Kalina. You know much, but what lies ahead of you is beyond anything you have faced. You were lucky to have survived in Paravese. I cannot protect you if you cannot protect yourself. Go home. Finish your homework and get some rest. We begin again before dawn. Again, do not partake in Diana's meals." and he walks away.

This training continues for weeks, each night ending in an argument with Diana wherein Kalina begs her not to confront Gael.

Diana sneaks out one night after Kali is fast asleep, searching for Gael who is mysteriously just outside of her door. The chat is brief as Gael says to the stunned girl, "What you do for her is noble, but she must learn to subsist on much less than this if she is to survive her Journey. Neither you nor I can be there with her in the times to come. I know you view me as an enemy, but I am not. Nothing you can say will change my training regimine. If you wish to help Kalina, engage her mind in her studies. She must strengthen her Inner Being. This will not continue much longer, but please do not interfere further, as it would be to her detriment." Diana asks Gael who he is and mentions some of Kali's ramblings about her theories. His face hardens and he stiffens then walks away without a word. One morning when Kali awakes and begins to carry water Gael takes the bucket from her and tells her to sit then completes the work for her. She is baffled by this but each time she attempts to help he commands her to watch the stars and await the sunrise. She smiles slightly at the thought of taking a break and does as he says. As the sun rises he returns with Torvan who invites her to attend breakfast with the 13. Korvana attends as well. She is fed a large breakfast which she tries her best to consume in a lady-like fashion, though she is still wearing her training garments, and the women all laugh giddly. Friede who is also there places a hand on her shoulder smiling and assures her that they mean no ill will by their laughter and encourages her to eat her fill.

After finishing eating Korvana asks Gael if she is ready to which he responds that he has done all that he can for her. She nods and then they discuss what comes next. Diana enters and is seated on the other side of Kalina, grasping her hand, smiling lovingly. "The two of you have become like sisters I see. This is good" says Torvan. Korvana looks down her nose sharply at the two of them analyzing some unspoken acknowledgement with her mind, and then informs Kalina that her training has ended. When Kalina asks what comes next it dawns on all of them that they have no idea. The 13 all look to Korvana whose stern gaze is still fixed on the two girls, but Torvan smiles knowingly. Friede laughs aloud, but Gael closes his eyes as if in pain and bows his head. Diana smiles, rubbing Kali's hand lovingly looking at her friend. Kalina exasperated by the lack of response asks again to which Torvan responds, "What comes next is up to you Kalina - You are the The Warlord of Light, the First of Those Who Return. We cannot tell you what comes next because we do not know, but you are welcome to have free reign of Lauriden. My suggestion is that you regain your strength through relaxing, spending time with your friend, getting to know the Elves a bit, and perhaps enjoying yourself." Kalina does just that but after only 3 weeks another tragedy strikes. One peaceful night the notorious Dark Worker Salazar Kadren attacks Lauriden along with a small army. Lauriden has never before been invaded and the people are caught completely off guard. Tree Whisperers manage to fight off most of them having the Sacred Ash Trees assist. Salazar himself clashes with Gael who attempts to protect Diana and Kalina but when Kalina rushes out to help he is caught off guard and badly injured, his fear for Kalina momentarily distracting him long enough for Salazar to drive his sword through his chest. Gael gasps, eyes wide and collapses to the ground. This unfocuses Kalina who is then easily captured by Salazar's men and then just as suddenly as the attack began, it ends.

Diana rushes out to tend to Gael who is dying but with the help of her other nurse-maids they manage to save his life. The 13 gather along with Korvana. Friede has disappeared yet again, but as plans are being made to go after Salazar and find and free Kalina, Torvan shoots the idea down, stating in his mysterious way that The Warlord will be just fine, and that he has other business to attend to. The 13 are baffled by this, but look to Korvana for a response. She hesitantly reminds them that if The Watcher says she will be okay then they too must trust that her Training wasn't for naught. Diana bursts into the meeting just as its ending distraught at their decision, yet is commanded to tend to Gael.

In captivity somewhere deep within the Forlorn Forests the omniously vague warnings of Torvan and Gael flood Kalina's mind, troubling her very soul. She is left for many weeks in silent darkness. Half starved and sleep deprived The Ritual of The Dark Workers begins. A Dark Worker by the name of Oolga Varhose gathers her group of Dark Withces and begin to implore brainwashing tactics they've designed to cause Kalina to sever her Immortal Link with her Embodied Soul. For 6 weeks Kali is subjected to both physical and psychological torture. She begins to realize just how vital Gael's training was as she struggles to hold on to all that she learned when in Lauriden. Oolga's tempting and torture tactics are much worse than any of Gael's training though and eventually she gives in and consents to the Dark Workers.

[Plot Hole] - Why can't they just kill her and get it over with? - [Plot Hole] [[Will Figure out when writing first draft and see what comes out because this scene requires that she obtain the SoulBlade for later on in the story -- Again haven't fully developed idea, but SoulBlade is Kalina's main weapon throughout The Unveiling and this is how she gets it.]] Just before the SoulBlade slices into her, Torvan's words invade her mind again, shaking her free of the Mind Control. Her battle training pays off. She manages to turn the Blade against Oolga and escapes, taking the SoulBlade with her as she takes off into the Forlorn Forests. Kalina spends many months traveling back to Paravese after this and during her travels her connection to the Trees deepens as her Path becomes clearer. This lone journey is the True Catalyst which Awakens her, as the previous happenstances were all merely mental preparation. Alone amongst Nature she bears witness to the truth of all that she has read about and studied. Her battle training allows her to protect herself from the wild things which lie in wait and also to obtain food, but her Soul Encodings activate fully one morning, at First Light on the 7th day of the 7th month, at the end of the 77th Epoch, Kalina notices the Sunlight, as if for the first time peeking over the horizon. She smiles and recalls that morning with Gael. A days walk later she encounters a band of hunters at a campfire who half-drunkenly invite her to attend their meal. They ask cautiously about her SoulBlade, eyeing it warily but she is hesitant to speak much about it. They warn her of Dark Workers and one of the men offers his tent to her. They are very respectful and do not bother her. The man who offered his tent keeps watch during the night allowing for the others to sleep. In the morning they give her directions towards Lauriden, astounded at her tale and desire to visit the Elves. When she mentions Tree Whisperers their eyes go wide and they hurriedly repeat their directions and start packing up camp. As she leaves she can hear them whispering in hushed tones about the SoulBlade once more. They give her a pack of dried meat and mead to take along with her, telling her that it is about a weeks walk. Diana is hanging clothes on the line one afternoon when she spots Kalina coming out of the woods into the valley and is overjoyed, rushing to embrace her. They spend the night together before telling anyone else of her arrival. The next morning Gael and Torvan gather the 13 and hear of Kalina's travels. Kali is a changed woman, no longer unsure of herself or her Path. She advises them that she must return to see her Cousin. She is most relieved to find Gael doing well, and asks if they can spar before they leave. He obliges.

Korvana asks about the SoulBlade and when Kalina lays it upon the table the 13 all gasp. She is then told the origins of the blade. It is said that the Blade has the power to Sever the Immortal Link of Those who Return, destroying the Embodied Soul itself. It is a weapon of disastrous consequence. It can only be wielded by A StarWalker, which is a connundrum in and of itself, (Which explains Oolga's Dark Ritual Mind Control) but if used prevents the Soul from Reincarnating again. There are only 5 Star Walkers, and all 5 are needed to keep the Demons in the Box locked away. Should the SoulBlade be used all hope would be lost. The only way that it could be used effectively however would be if one of the StarWalkers either turned it upon themselves, or used it against another. It was created 5,000 years ago by Dark Workers under the guidance of Orunibu. The Tree Whisperers have searched for it ever since in an attempt to prevent it from being used against the StarWalkers, but it was kept hidden. The Sun Speakers advised the Tree Whisperers to abandon thier quest long ago in an attempt to keep the peace between the rival factions, but the Trees would not have it. The Lore goes much deeper and volume after volume has been compiled by Tree Whisperers about the weapon. It is a new creation and as such is not mentioned in Elvish Lore, though Torvan when seeing it says, "Oh Yes, there it is" as if he had foreknowledge of it's role in Kali's destiny. She is advised to keep it but is warned that it may corrupt her. [More on this later as story develops] Kalina, Diana, Torvan and Gael saddle up and begin their journey back to the Palace after a nights rest. When she returns to Paravese she finds that Vivanna is now queen. Her aunt and uncle were killed in the initial raid. Vivianna plans a ball to be thrown welcoming Kalina back, but Vivanna refuses to hear anything about her adventures. She outfits Diana in royal garb and treats her to every delicacy she has to offer. Kalina and Diana both blush when Vivianna hints at their obvious love affair, stating that they are obviously "More than just friends". Friede, who has not been seen since Kalina was captured poses as a washmaiden and skeaps with Kalina while she readies for the ball the following evening and speaks with Kalina, stressing the importance of finding "The Others". Kalina agrees, smiling slightly, asking why Friede took the trouble to disguise herself. Friede cackles and says, "I enjoy flying under the radar, unlike Torvan, the audacious fool!" and scurries away. The ball commences and Kalina and Diana dance together, the crowd looking on in awe. It is unheard of that two women should dance together, but with Vivianna being queen now none dare speak out about the unconventional arraingment. Vivianna has made several drastic changes to the way that the Palace is run, the first of which being that she refused to marry, or conceive of an heir. Her dictates caused an uproar at first, but after dismissing over half of the Royal Court from their duties and appointing new subjects the rest of the Palace followed suit, fearing to cross the young new Queen. The night goes on without any disturbances. That night, in a dream Kalina encounters each of the Other 4. Tamil, Ladrick, Avendar, and Morgana. They each seem to be lucidly there in the dream state. None of them know what is going on except for Kalina, who tells them that she will be coming to them soon. She awakes and tells Diana of her dream and Diana hurriedly begins packing. Kalina dresses and heads out of her chambers. After speaking with Friede and Torvan about her dream Kalina sets to telling Vivianna of all that has transpired and all that must come next, but Vivianna does take kindly to hearing of "The Demons in the Box" and "Orunibu" and forbids Kalina from leaving the Palace and even goes so far as to ordering that guards be set to forcibly keep her from leaving. The debate gets rather heated, but the Queen stands, lifting a hand and turning her head saying, "Enough!" and Kalina is dragged out of the ThroneRoom and back to her chambers where a giddy Diana has just finished packing. After Kalina informs her of what transpired Diana's face turns sour, but Kalina smirks, grabbing the SoulBlade and her other sword belt, strapping it on. "Are you ready?" she asks confidently. Diana nods timidly, "What are you going to do?" Kalina replies, "I'm going to find the others, and you're coming with me." Diana smiles, "But what of the guards?" Kali unsheathes the SoulBlade from her back and asks, "What guards?" and slices through the bolts of the door causing it to drop to the floor. The guards turn and rush in but when they see the SoulBlade glowing with its shimmering dark blade they drop their weapons and run away. Kalina and Diana make their way down the corridor into a hidden passageway Kalina used to play hide-and-seek in as a child and shortly after they are beyond the Palace walls, headed west in search of Tamil, "The Teacher".

{"name": "First_Light_Synopsis", "type": "document", "content": "Extended Synopsis: "First Light"\n\nKalina Dodson, seventeen-year-old cousin to Princess Vivianna, is a gifted but restless royal who finds no comfort in the glittering halls of Paravese. As preparations begin for the annual Harvest Festival, she trains under the brooding swordsman Gael, distracted by vivid dreams and a deep inner disquiet. Her cousin's teasing and talk of matchmaking only deepen her disconnection from court life. During the festival, Kalina is introduced to Lord Haversham and despite their shared trauma and momentary spark, she finds no lasting comfort.\n\nA mysterious woman named Friede appears during the festivities, unsettling Kalina with cryptic words about destiny, ancient demons, and dreams that seem eerily familiar. Moments later, the ball descends into chaosDark Workers release poison gas and slaughter civilians in a coordinated strike. Kalina, forced into battle, barely survives a skirmish with four assassins before collapsing from her injuries.\n\nRescued by Friede and placed in the care of the enigmatic Torvan Dochavich, Kalina is rushed through treacherous terrain to Lauriden, a mythical Elven city hidden in the Vorheel Mountains. There, Tree Whisperers nurse her back to health while she befriends a young Elf named Diana. As Kalina recovers, she learns that her attackers targeted her because of her Soul Encodingsancient markings that link her to a lineage of reincarnated protectors known as the Star Walkers.\n\nTorvan, Friede, and a circle of Elven elders called the 13, led by the stern Korvana, inform Kalina that she is the Warlord of Lightone of five Star Walkers destined to fight Orunibu, a timeless psychic parasite that blinds humanity to truth. Despite her resistance, Kalina agrees to train and study with the Elves, forging a deep bond with Diana and challenging the limits of her body and spirit under Gael's brutal instruction.\n\nKalinas training ends with no clear directive, and for a brief time she enjoys peace. But that peace shatters when the infamous Dark Worker Salazar Kadren leads an assault on Lauriden. Gael is gravely wounded, and Kalina is captured. Subjected to six weeks of psychological torture by the sorceress Oolga Varhose, Kalina is nearly broken. Just before her soul is severed in a dark ritual, Torvan's guidance snaps her back to clarity. She slays Oolga, steals the SoulBlade, and escapes.\n\nAlone in the Forlorn Forests, Kalina journeys back to Paravese. Her time in solitude catalyzes her Awakening. On the 7th day of the 7th month, at First Light, she fully activates her Soul Encodings. Along the way, she meets travelers who recognize the power of the SoulBlade and treat her with reverence and fear.\n\nShe returns to Lauriden, stronger and self-possessed. The 13 reveal the SoulBlade's originsit can sever the immortal link of a reincarnated soul, permanently destroying it. It was made by Dark Workers to kill Star Walkers and was hidden for millennia. The Tree Whisperers warn her of its corruptive power, but acknowledge her need to keep it.\n\nKalina and her companions return to Paravese where she finds Vivianna now Queen, her aunt and uncle victims of the earlier attack. Vivianna welcomes her cousin but refuses to hear of her journey or the danger ahead. Kalina and Dianas relationship deepens, publicly confirmed at a royal ball. That night, Kalina dreams of the other four Star WalkersTamil, Ladrick, Avendar, and Morganaand promises to find them.\n\nHer attempt to leave is blocked by Queen Vivianna, who orders Kalina held within the palace. Kalina and Diana break free, the SoulBlade parting steel as easily as silk. The guards, terrified, allow their escape. They vanish into the hidden paths of Kalina's childhood, beginning a journey westward in search of The TeacherTamiland the remaining Star Walkers, thus setting in motion the true unfolding of the Unveiling.\n\nThis is the tale of Kalina the Warlord of Lightfirst of Those Who Returnand her march toward the truth of all things hidden."}

Purpose, Orunibu, and The Demons in the Box. Short Synopsis Vivianna taunts Kalina while she trains with Gael the Swordsmaster, urging her to stop jousting and to get ready for the party. Kalina, frustrated with her older cousin finishes up her lesson and begrudgingly heads back to her chambers. Once the ball starts Kalina hangs around the edges of the party, sneaking mead in secret, attempting to remain numb. Vivianna attempts to set her up to dance with the young Lord Haversham of Tramalax. Kalina takes kindly to Haversham but upon returning from the restroom she cannot find him. She is approached by an old woman who identifies herself as "Friede" who insists that she "Wake Up" telling her all kinds of strange Pseudo-Relgious jargon, and things about Star Walkers. As Kalina attempts to disengage the Party descends into madness as a group of Dark Workers who were covertly already attending the party detonate poison gas and begin slaughtering anyone they run across. A brief swordfight ensues leaving Kalina badly injured and barely alive, but Fried drags her from the Palace. Friede deposits her on the saddle of her companion Torvan Dochavich who after exchange a few key words gallops off towards Lauriden in the night, with a half-dead Kalina in tow. When Kalina awakes she is surprised to find herself in the care of The Elves. After she is nursed back to health she is invited to a feast in which she is introduced by Torvan to a group of Tree Whisperers. The conversation that ensues leaves Kali quite confused. They keep referring to her as "The Warlord of Light" Korvana, chief among the small group of Tree Whisperers becomes Kalina's tutor, spending several months educating Kali in The Forgotten Knowledge. Also, battle training continues. Gael has been summoned by Torvan. One peaceful night a notorious Dark Worker by the name of Salazar Kadren attacks the village and manages to kidnap Kalina, leaving Gael badly injured. A group gathers together in an attempt to find and free her, but Torvan declines to assist, stating that he must be about other business and that The Warlord will be just fine. In captivity Torvan's ominously vague warnings flood Kalina's mind, troubling her very soul. After many weeks of silent darkness, half starved and sleep deprived, The Ritual begins. Oolga Varhose and her band of Dark Witches implore brainwashing tactics designed to cause Kalina to sever her Immortal Link with her Embodied Soul. For 6 weeks Kali is subjected to both physical and psychological torture. In an attempt to finally end her suffering, Kalina gives in to Oolga's tempting and consents to the Dark Workers. Just before the SoulBlade slices into her, Torvan's words invade her mind again, shaking her free of the Mind Control. Her battle training pays off. She turns the blade against Oolga and escapes. Taking the SoulBlade with her she takes off into the Forlorn Forests. Kalin spends many months traveling back to Paravese, but during her travels her connection to the Trees deepends as her Path becomes clear. This lone journey is the True Catalyst which Awakens her. At First Light on the 7th day of the 7th month, the end of the 77th Epoch, Kalina notices the Sunlight, as if seeing it for the first time. Kalina manages to find her way back to Lauriden and regroups with Gael and Diana who accompany her back to the Palace. When she returns to Paravese she finds that Vivianna is now queen. Her parents were killed in the initial raid. She throws a ball welcoming Kalina back, but refuses to hear anything about her adventures. Friede poses as a washmaiden and speaks with Kalina while she readies for the ball and stresses the importance of finding "The Others". That night in a dream, each of the 4 appear to Kalina. After speakining with Friede and Torvan about her dream Kalina sets to telling Vivianna of all that has transpired, and all that must come next. Vivianna doesn't take kindly to hearing of "The Demons in the Box" and forbids Kalina from leaving, even going so far as to ordering guards to forcibly keep her within the Palace grounds. Kali faces down her guards with the SoulBlade which leaves them all stunned with shock and awe at the Infernal Weapon's very existence. They let her leave without further interference, all without Vivianna knowing until it's too late. Kali heads West in search of "The Teacher".

2025-08-18T15:20:07.396074Z assistant

{"name": "purpose_orunibu_synopsis", "type": "document", "content": "Short Synopsis: Purpose, Orunibu, and The Demons in the Box\n\nVivianna taunts Kalina while she trains with Gael the Swordsmaster, urging her to stop jousting and get ready for the party. Kalina, frustrated with her older cousin, finishes up her lesson and begrudgingly heads back to her chambers. Once the ball starts, Kalina hangs around the edges of the party, sneaking mead in secret, attempting to remain numb.\n\nVivianna attempts to set her up to dance with the young Lord Haversham of Tramalax. Kalina takes kindly to Haversham, but upon returning from the restroom she cannot find him. She is approached by an old woman who identifies herself as "Friede," who insists that she "Wake Up," speaking strange pseudo-religious jargon about Star Walkers.\n\nAs Kalina attempts to disengage, the party descends into madness. A group of Dark Workers who were covertly attending the party detonate poison gas and begin slaughtering anyone they run across. A brief swordfight ensues, leaving Kalina badly injured and barely alive, but Friede drags her from the Palace. She deposits her on the saddle of her companion, Torvan Dochavich, who after exchanging a few key words gallops off towards Lauriden in the night with a half-dead Kalina in tow.\n\nWhen Kalina awakes, she is surprised to find herself in the care of the Elves. After she is nursed back to health, she is invited to a feast where Torvan introduces her to a group of Tree Whisperers. The conversation that ensues leaves Kali quite confused. They keep referring to her as "The Warlord of Light."\n\nKorvana, chief among the small group of Tree Whisperers, becomes Kalina's tutor, spending several months educating her in The Forgotten Knowledge. Meanwhile, her battle training continues, with Gael summoned by Torvan to resume Kalina's swordwork.\n\nOne peaceful night, the notorious Dark Worker Salazar Kadren attacks the village and manages to kidnap Kalina, leaving Gael badly injured. A group gathers to find and free her, but Torvan declines to assist, stating that he must be about other business and that The Warlord will be just fine.\n\nIn captivity, Torvan's ominous warnings flood Kalina's mind, troubling her very soul. After many weeks of silent darkness, half-starved and sleep-deprived, the Ritual begins. Oolga Varhose and her band of Dark Witches employ brainwashing tactics designed to sever Kalina's Immortal Link with her Embodied Soul. For six weeks, Kalina is subjected to both physical and psychological torture. In an attempt to end her suffering, Kalina gives in to Oolga's tempting and consents to the Dark Workers.\n\nJust before the SoulBlade slices into her, Torvan's words invade her mind again, shaking her free of the Mind Control. Her battle training pays off. She turns the blade against Oolga and escapes. Taking the SoulBlade with her, she flees into the Forlorn Forests.\n\nKalina spends many months traveling back to Paravese. During her travels, her connection to the Trees deepens as her Path becomes clear. This lone journey is the true catalyst that Awakens her. At First Light on the 7th day of the 7th month, the end of the 77th Epoch, Kalina notices the Sunlight as if seeing it for the first time.\n\nShe manages to find her way back to Lauriden and regroups with Gael and Diana, who accompany her back to the Palace.\n\nWhen she returns to Paravese, she finds that Vivianna is now queen. Her parents were killed in the initial raid. Vivianna throws a ball to welcome Kalina back but refuses to hear anything about her adventures.\n\nFriede poses as a washmaiden and speaks with Kalina while she readies for the ball, stressing the importance of finding "The Others."\n\nThat night, in a dream, each of the four appears to Kalina. After speaking with Friede and Torvan about her dream, Kalina attempts to tell Vivianna all that has transpired and what must come next. \n\nVivianna does not take kindly to hearing of "The Demons in the Box" and forbids Kalina from leaving, even going so far as to order guards to forcibly keep her within the Palace grounds.\n\nKalina faces down the guards with the SoulBlade, leaving them stunned by the infernal weapon's very existence. They let her leave without further interference, all without Vivianna knowing until it's too late.\n\nKalina and Diana escape through a hidden passageway and head West in search of "The Teacher.""}

INTERLUDE - The Failures Of Druids

Chapter 4 - The Watcher Instead of regaining her seat at the Royal Table, once she reached the top of the staircase, Kalina headed through the archway and down the empty hall. She had grown up in the Castle, and as such, knew every nook and cranny of the place as well as one knew their own face in a mirror. She slipped through a door around the corner, closing it behind her swiftly. Breathing heavily, she turned from the door and splashed cool water onto her face. She glanced at the lavatory then grimaced. "I don't know how anyone deals with this on a consistent basis." After managing to relieve herself without ruining her dress, she breathed deeply, gathering herself, then opened the door. She was as prepared as she was likely to get. Letting out another breath, she exited and began making her way up the hall, back to the people and festivities. The girl found solace in realizing that not only was she returning to the scrutinizing eye of the public, but also, Seth would be there too. She smiled at this. She wasn't exactly sure why she had kissed Haversham. It was a spur of the moment thing. He was cute, but she wasn't interested in finding a suitor, nor would she let herself be bothered with such trivial and meaningless forays - Besides, there were Dark Workers to consider - Matters of true import. She couldn't allow Royal Dictates, or even cute Generals, to distract her. She would focus on dismantling their entire Order. She would..."Hello there deary, might I have a word?" came a peculiarly familiar voice. Kalina spun quickly, peering into the darkness of the hallway behind her. The voice was too close for comfort. She gazed back at the fragile old crone holding herself up on a cane. Kalina was beyond startled. How had anyone, especially such a feeble old lady, managed to escape her ever perceptive senses. Evading Kalina's detection was near impossible! "Oh my," the frail, grey-haired woman exclaimed, "I do apologize love. I never meant to startle you." Kalina's mind went wild. She hadn't passed by this woman and simply failed to notice. She would have seen a trained spy, regardless of their attempts to camouflage themselves in the shadows. She would have sensed them. Heard their breathing. Smelled their scent. The girl tensed all the more, realizing that she had not only been caught off guard, but she was also without a sword. "I simply seek a word," the woman seemed to struggle with her cane as she neared the girl, "You can surely spare a moment can't you?" Kalina raised a single suspicious eyebrow. The woman let out a laugh, shaking her head slightly, "Oh come now Kali, we both know you would rather be anywhere than back in the public eye. Let us sit down and have a chat. It's long overdue I suppose." Kalina hadn't seen the bench the lady gestured towards, and as the lady sat down, the girl found herself even more on edge. She'd never seen a bench here in the past. In fact, as she scanned her near photographic memory, she couldn't remember it being there when she'd first come down the hall. What was happening?She began to take a step backwards, away from the eerie situation beginning to unfold, but the woman locked eyes with her, speaking in a tone that commanded, no - Demanded, respect. "Sit down girl. I'm not here to hurt you." Kalina froze, unable to break eye contact, paralyzed by something indescribable. For the very first time in her short life she found herself confronted by an encounter she couldn't control. Her mind frantically searched for some explanation, for the woman's mysterious appearance, the bench, that look..."Come now," the woman patted the bench beside her with a wrinkled hand, "Take a seat." The young girl feverishly began to move, stuttering as she did, "I... I'm... I... I..." She finally reached the bench, "My... My... I...""Yes, yes. I startled you..." The woman raised an eyebrow, leaning a shoulder in towards the troubled girl, raising an eyebrow and laughing a bit, "And that's something that never happens. Not to you anyway. As I said, I do apologize." "What... Um... Where..." Kali's mind stalled. She couldn't form a single sentence or coherent thought. The woman was right. Being caught off guard by anyone, other than perhaps Gael in a practice session, was something that never happened. Ever. "My name is Friede," the old woman said, gazing deep into Kalina's wide green eyes, "I wasn't here until I was, and neither was this bench. If I explained, you wouldn't believe me, and if you did, I'd assume you'd lost your mind, so never mind with all of that." she raised her eyebrows and took a breath. "Friede... Nice to me... Nice to mee..." Kalina shook her head violently, as if that would clear her mind of the fog that had descended. "Yes love, it's nice to meet you too." Friede said, cutting her off as she continued in a serious tone, "I suppose we had best get the heavier aspects of this conversation out of the way, so let me answer the question haunting your mind."Kalina nodded slightly, unaware that she did, leaning in a bit towards the woman who held her transfixed with her otherworldly gaze. "I am one of The Watchers." Something sparked in the girls mind. A sudden realization. A faint and shrouded memory echoed through her mind, and a deep curiosity stole across her face. "There are Two of Us - Watchers that is." Friede extended a hand, gently patting the girls knee as she continued, "That's what they call us anyway. Me and a foolish man I'm sure you'll meet soon enough. We are Those who Await the Return." A whisper left Kali's lips, but it was no more than a muffled sound. Friede continued, nodding as if in agreement with the girl's unspoken response, "The Tree Whisperers tell of two witnesses. Two Watchers who remain. Very ancient stuff you see. I quite prefer the Elves' account of affairs, but they've become so covetous of their Sacred Texts, since last you were here, that I'm afraid had you delayed any longer, soon the World of Men would be left to their own devices." The woman seemed to stare off into the distance, momentarily lost in thought, looking through Kalina as it were, but the girl was still unable to look away from those mystical eyes. "Since last I was here?" the girl asked before she realized she had spoke. Friede smiled, more of a smirk, narrowing her eyes a bit, "Each Epoch, the Warlord of Light returns first..." she raised both eyebrows, inclining her head towards Kali, "To keep The Dark at bay for the others while they do their Sacred Work." "The Warlord?" Kalina asked, all more astounded by the old woman's words. Friede nodded, "You're always the first to Awaken. The first to Remember, and the last to depart. The Guardian of All. The one who protects The Sacred Garden. The ender of Wars across Stars. The Undefeated One" Friede raised an eyebrow, leaning in towards the girl, "You clear the way, and secure the rear. Without you, the others cannot Walk." Sudden and intensely vivid memories flashed inside the young girl's mind, all without context, devoid of explanation, each completely undecipherable. She physically jerked, as half formed images flickered to life then died just as swiftly, transpiring all within but a few brief moments, Kalina witnessed countless lifetimes unfold. Memories far older than any recorded histories she'd studied. Memories of herself. Lives lived long ago. Incarnations too varied to conceive, but recollections so real no room was left for doubt. In mere seconds, which to Kalina seemed to last an eternity, her mind was filled with volumes of history no library could contain, and just as suddenly as it began, the episode ended. Friede raised an inquisitive eyebrow again, "I see that Gael hasn't deigned to speak a word of this to you." she sighed, "Just SwordPlay I suspect..." She eyed the girl warily, "Ah well, I suppose that is his way." Kalina finally blinked, "What about Gael?" Friede let out a sigh, looking down at the ground as she shook her head, "Do you not even know of what lies in the East? Are you unaware of the Dark Portal? Have you no knowledge of Orunibu and the Demons in the Box?" The girl stared blankly back at her, slowly shaking her head in response. The old woman's mouth opened in shock, eyebrows lifting, "It is a shame that even in Paravesia, the Legends go untaught. History forgotten. Truth covered over, silenced by neglect and ignorance." she eyed Kalina even more warily and asked, "Have you truly been kept from the Forgotten Knowledge? You know nothing of who and what you truly are?" Kalina was dumbfounded. By the experience. By the conversation. By the woman's mention of Gael, and just... all of it. "No, I haven't, but I'll listen." Friede pursed her lips, tightening her eyes as she stared back in disbelief at the girl, "You," she began after a pause, "are The Warlord of Light my dear Kalina, the Ender of Wars across Stars. You have Returned. Incarnated, once more, into flesh and bone. The memories you just witnessed, those images flashing behind your eyes... That is not mere happenstance child. They are yours. They were not just things you imagined. They were real. You are here again, and not a moment too soon I'd say." Kalina's eyes grew fearful. There it was. The eerie pull of destiny, made manifest at last. Her whole life she'd felt it, undefined and veiled, yet present. It was insanity, but undeniable. What the woman spoke was true, and in the depths of her soul, Kalina knew. Friede continued, "You are an Ancient Star Walker, back to Seal the Darkness away." she paused, "Or rather, to ensure it remains sealed." Kalina blinked, "What darkness?" Friede gasped, "Have you heard nothing I've said girl? The Demons in the Box. They remain where you caged them long ago, but each Epoch you Return with the Others to ensure that they do not escape." Kalina scrunched up her face a bit at this. It was all too much. "Gael really should have at least mentioned Orunibu to you..." Friede said, tapping a finger against her lips, a confused look upon her face. "Who?" Friede tossed both hands into the air in frustration, "My dear child, you have much to learn, and unfortunately, we haven't the time for me to teach you." The old woman's face took on a look of compassion, "Suffice it to say that such things will have to wait until a more opportune moment." Kalina let out a huff, "What is that supposed to mean?" Friede began to stand up, "Well girl, I told you I only wanted a small moment of your time, and so I have taken it." She looked down at the confused girl, "You really don't sense them yet?" she asked raising an eyebrow. Kalina cocked her head to the side inquisitively, "What?" Friede gestured her hands towards the girl, urging her to pause for a moment, "Listen girl. Stop for a moment and feel your surroundings. "Kalina's eyes went wide, then she understood. She could feel it. The disturbance on the wind. "Mind you now girl, you're still without Sword." the woman rocked back a bit, looking down her nose at her before leaning in reprovingly, wagging a finger, "Don't you go rushing toward danger unarmed. These are Dark Workers!"Kalina's jaw dropped. Friede raised both eyebrows, nodding slightly as she continued, "Yes girl," she poked Kalina on her sore shoulder, "You didn't think we had this chat just for the fun of it did you?" She pursed her lips in disapproval as the stunned girl failed to respond with more than a bewildered stare, "You'll face real enemies tonight dear. Not hooligans, thugs, nor over zealous guards. No love, Servants of the Dark lie in wait, and had you been paying attention you would have sensed them long before this silly Festival began. "Shock rolled over Kalina anew as she delved into the uncanny awareness which she possessed. The woman was right. She could feel it - could feel them! She scanned her memories of the day's events and found that indeed, the same unsettling itch had been with her since dawn. Until now it had gone undefined, brushed off as pre-dance jitters. "They're here for you Kalina." She narrowed her eyes towards the girl, emphasizing her seriousness, "For you alone I'm afraid. They've come in force this night to finish what they attempted when you were but a babe. Gael may have driven the assassins away, but this is a coordinated attack. The chaos alone will be enough to occupy our Master of Sword." "My sword is in my chambers, beneath the bed." Friede raised an eyebrow, "Then I suggest you discreetly make your way there, and quickly. You'll find that no aide comes to your rescue once they decide to strike. They've been planning this for some time. It's inevitable that you'll find yourself isolated and overwhelmed, but I suspect Gael has trained you well enough to handle such odds." she leaned in towards her, "I just want to make sure you understand that this time the fight is real - and it's to the death girl! You'd be wise to remember that." "How do you know all of this?" Kalina asked, suddenly suspicious of the old woman. Friede smiled back, "I know many things, but this I overheard year after year in the Dark Tower as they rehearsed their schemes." she laughed a bit, "For such a formidable enemy faction, their ranks were quite easy to infiltrate." she shrugged, "I suppose it never crossed their mind that any would dare invade their homeland, but not all of us fear the Dark." Kalina began to fidget in her seat, the gnawing feeling growing with each passing moment.

Souls incarnate freely. Humans are Guardians and Caretakers. The Demons in the Box utilize Wetiko to try to escape their prison and destroy the Garden. Every 33,000 years humanity forgets their purpose even more. The Ancient Starwalkers Return each Epoch (7th Cycle of 33,000 years) to keep the Demons locked away.

"First Light" tells the story of Kalina's Awakening and beginning the Journey to find the others like her and awakening them to the Truth of their Purpose, Orunibu, and The Demons in the Box.
